A3. It benefits older workers by creating a more inclusive & respectful workplace #culture, where they‚Äôre valued for their experience & knowledge. Also enables a supportive & accommodating environment which means engaged, motivated & productive workers. #MercerChats #FutureOfWork

@LisaLint üòÇ love this @LisaLint. One big hurdle as we go forward will be unconscious bias. No matter how good the infrastructure is, the benefits, accessibility etc, humans are one another‚Äôs worst enemy. We must truly approach #aging in the #future of work with a DEI mindset. #mercerchats

@Jlmerrick It‚Äôs a must have endeavor I‚Äôd say @Jlmerrick. Always have the skills to choose your next step and create your destiny. Cutting back on learning limits us, investing in learning empowers us. #mercerchats #megachat #futureofwork #aging

@TamaraMcCleary It‚Äôs truly exciting @TamaraMcCleary. One can reinvent oneself and truly live multiple career lives. So different from the past where one career for 30 years was it. The future is bright. #mercerchats #megachat #longevity in the #FutureOfWork

A1. Companies must adapt their approach to work, career experiences, benefits, retirement and what aging means to name a few. It‚Äôs a massive and much needed transformation that will need to address a lot of unconscious bias along the way. #longevity #futureofwork #mercerchats

@mercer A2. Employees are the lifeblood of an organization. If the foundation crumbles so does the business. Plus it is the right thing to do! If you want your people to do their best at work, organizations need to equally do their best for their people. #MercerChats #healthcare

A7. Be a workplace that promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion. A workplace that creates a positive and inclusive work environment for everyone. If every organization could do just that, imagine the #FutureOfWork. #MercerChats #megachat #wef23

A6. Instead of balance, can we align? People are the lifeblood of an organization, key to success. Find those critical elements that are required for both boards and employees and focus there. #MercerChats #megachat

A5. Employees hold the power, if they don‚Äôt like what an organization offers they leave. It is truly a mutual two-way relationship. Organizations & leaders are expected to place more emphasis on transparency & trust, be purpose led & invest in their people. #MercerChats #megachat
@KateBravery Excellent call out @KateBravery, people want to be a part of something bigger than themselves. #mercerchats #megachat #futureofwork

@GageGrammer Yes. That‚Äôs such an important point @GageGrammer. I still remember once my manager declining my vacation time because said person thought we might have to focus on a new project. Imagine that today‚Ä¶ even then it was ridiculous. #mercerchats #megachat #futureofwork

A4. Understand what motivates people and how this varies by employee. Some may want traditional comp most, others growth opportunities and recognition, and others the flexibility with where and how they work is key. Know your audience! #MercerChats #wef23 #FutureOfWork

@Timothy_Hughes Your emphasis on two way is so important @Timothy_Hughes. Gone are the days of ivory tower #leadership and employees simply following along. Empowering all colleagues to share their voices is critical to success in today‚Äôs world of work. #mercerchats #futureofwork #wef23
